## toolkit package

## Functions

<table><thead><tr><th>

Function


</th><th>

Description


</th></tr></thead>
<tbody><tr><td>

[camelCase(string)](./toolkit.camelcase.md)


</td><td>

Converts a string to camel case.


</td></tr>
<tr><td>

[chunk(source, size)](./toolkit.chunk.md)


</td><td>

Creates an iterator that yields chunks of an array with the specified size.


</td></tr>
<tr><td>

[clonePrototype(source)](./toolkit.cloneprototype.md)


</td><td>

Clones the prototype of the provided object.

This function creates a new object with the same prototype chain as the provided object. The properties of the original object are not copied, and the new object has the same prototype as the original object.


</td></tr>
<tr><td>

[combinations(source)](./toolkit.combinations.md)


</td><td>

Generates all possible combinations of elements from the provided array. The combinations are generated in binary counting order, starting from empty array up to the full array.


</td></tr>
<tr><td>

[createSafeExecutor(fn)](./toolkit.createsafeexecutor.md)


</td><td>

Creates a safe executor function that wraps the provided function. The returned function will execute the provided function and return a result indicating whether the execution was successful or if an error occurred.


</td></tr>
<tr><td>

[getCallsites(stackTraceLimit)](./toolkit.getcallsites.md)


</td><td>

Get the call sites from the current stack trace.


</td></tr>
<tr><td>

[invert(source)](./toolkit.invert.md)


</td><td>

Inverts the keys and values of the provided object. Values must be valid property keys (string, number, or symbol). If a value is not a valid property key, it will be skipped.


</td></tr>
<tr><td>

[isAsyncFunction(fn)](./toolkit.isasyncfunction.md)


</td><td>

Checks if the given function is declared as an async function. Note that this only detects functions explicitly declared with the `async` keyword, not functions that return Promises.


</td></tr>
<tr><td>

[kebabCase(string)](./toolkit.kebabcase.md)


</td><td>

Converts a string to kebab case.


</td></tr>
<tr><td>

[memoize(fn, options)](./toolkit.memoize.md)


</td><td>

Memoizes the provided function, caching its results based on the arguments.


</td></tr>
<tr><td>

[omit(source, args)](./toolkit.omit.md)


</td><td>

Omits the specified properties from the source object.


</td></tr>
<tr><td>

[pascalCase(string)](./toolkit.pascalcase.md)


</td><td>

Converts a string to pascal case.


</td></tr>
<tr><td>

[pick(source, args)](./toolkit.pick.md)


</td><td>

Picks the specified properties from the source object.


</td></tr>
<tr><td>

[snakeCase(string)](./toolkit.snakecase.md)


</td><td>

Converts a string to snake case.


</td></tr>
<tr><td>

[unwrap(maybe, error)](./toolkit.unwrap.md)


</td><td>

Unwraps a value and ensures it is not null or undefined.

Inspired by rust's `unwrap` function.


</td></tr>
<tr><td>

[unwrapOr(maybe, fallback)](./toolkit.unwrapor.md)


</td><td>

Unwraps a value and ensures it is not null or undefined.

Inspired by rust's `unwrap_or` function.


</td></tr>
</tbody></table>

## Type Aliases

<table><thead><tr><th>

Type Alias


</th><th>

Description


</th></tr></thead>
<tbody><tr><td>

[ArrayElement](./toolkit.arrayelement.md)


</td><td>

Extracts the element type from an array type using type inference.


</td></tr>
<tr><td>

[InvertObject](./toolkit.invertobject.md)


</td><td>

Type utility that represents the inverted object. Used by the [invert()](./toolkit.invert.md) function to provide type-safe inversion.


</td></tr>
<tr><td>

[LiteralUnion](./toolkit.literalunion.md)


</td><td>

Represents a union of a literal type and a base type.


</td></tr>
<tr><td>

[Mutable](./toolkit.mutable.md)


</td><td>

Makes all properties of type `T` mutable by removing readonly modifiers recursively. This utility type works with nested objects and arrays.


</td></tr>
<tr><td>

[NullishValue](./toolkit.nullishvalue.md)


</td><td>

Represents a nullish value in TypeScript.

A nullish value is either `null` or `undefined`<!-- -->. This type is commonly used when working with the nullish coalescing operator (??) or optional chaining (?.).


</td></tr>
<tr><td>

[Or](./toolkit.or.md)


</td><td>

Utility type that handles optional types and provides default values. If T is undefined or null, returns the default type D.


</td></tr>
<tr><td>

[OrAny](./toolkit.orany.md)


</td><td>

Shorthand for Or<!-- -->&lt;<!-- -->T, any<!-- -->&gt;<!-- -->. Uses 'any' as the default type. Useful when you want to ensure a non-undefined value but don't care about the type.


</td></tr>
<tr><td>

[SafeExecutor](./toolkit.safeexecutor.md)


</td><td>

Represents a safe executor function that wraps the provided function.


</td></tr>
<tr><td>

[SafeExecutorResult](./toolkit.safeexecutorresult.md)


</td><td>

Represents the result of a safe execution, either successful or failed.


</td></tr>
<tr><td>

[SafeResult](./toolkit.saferesult.md)


</td><td>

Represents the result of a safe execution, either successful or failed.


</td></tr>
<tr><td>

[UnwrapResult](./toolkit.unwrapresult.md)


</td><td>


</td></tr>
